newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Chang Hwa Bank cuts prime lending rate.
newsitem.headline: Chang Hwa Bank cuts prime lending rate.

text.p: Chang Hwa Bank, one of Taiwan's "big three" state banks, said on Monday it was cutting its prime lending rate by 0.025 percentage points to 7.525 percent, effective on Tuesday.
Chang Hwa was cutting its various time deposit rates by between 0.10 and 0.25 percentage points, also effective on Tuesday, the bank said in a statement.

The other two "big three" banks, Hua Nan Bank and First Commercial Bank, on Saturday announced they would cut their prime lending rates by the same 0.025 percentage points to 7.525 percent, effective from Monday.
Recent loose liquidity has forced the island's major banks to lower rates. Taiwan's largest state-run commercial bank, Bank of Taiwan, cut its rates on October 16.
